meanings.definition: To remove the establishment or official status of something.
meanings.sent1: The government is disestablishing the outdated law.
meanings.sent2: The committee is discussing disestablishing the old rules.
meanings.sent3: The students found disestablishing the strict dress code quite liberating.
meanings.sent4: Disestablishing the traditional norms opened up new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: She is actively disestablishing the barriers to progress.

meanings.definition: The act of ending the recognition or support of an established institution or organization.
meanings.sent1: The disestablishing of the monarchy led to significant changes.
meanings.sent2: The community's disestablishing of the local charity caused controversy.
meanings.sent3: The sudden disestablishing of the club's leadership left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The disestablishing of the company's policies shook the industry.
meanings.sent5: The gradual disestablishing of the tradition sparked debates among members.
